verses.roman:
gauḍodyānaṁ gaura-meghaḥ
siñcan svālokanāmṛtaiḥ
bhavāgni-dagdha-janatā-
vīrudhaḥ samajīvayat

synonyms: gauḍa-udyānam—upon the garden known as Gauḍa-deśa; gaura-meghaḥ—the cloud known as Gaura; siñcan—pouring water; sva—His own; ālokana-amṛtaiḥ—with the nectar of the glance; bhava-agni—by the blazing fire of material existence; dagdha—having been burnt; janatā—the people in general; vīrudhaḥ—who are like creepers and plants; samajīvayat—revived.
translation: By the nectar of His personal glance, the cloud known as Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu poured water upon the garden of Gauḍa-deśa and revived the people, who were like creepers and plants burning in the forest fire of material existence.
